intro: Wurfbainia villosa var. xanthioides, commonly known as the yellow-flowered sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late summer. Its leaves are typically covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive silvery appearance. This species is well adapted to harsh, dry environments and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils.
